results.title: Darrow = Clarence Darrow: attorney for the damned
results.creator_credit: KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.), Heus-Stept Productions, Richard Heus, Stephen Stept and John David Coles
results.brief_description: Born in 1857 in Ohio, Clarence Darrow was to become one of the most famous and highly recognised lawyers in America, most notably through the defence of Eugene Debs during the Pullman railroad strike (1894), the Nathan Leopold and Richard Loeb murder trial (1924) and the John Scopes “Monkey trial” (1925). He was a defender and a champion of the poor, an intellect, and a paradox, leaving his successful country practice in Ohio to become a Chicago based lawyer where he entertained and became the darling of the young intellectuals, his Chicago apartment the site for frequent gatherings. In 1907 Darrow successfully defended Bill Haywood and other leaders of the Western Federation of Miners, accused in the bombing-assassination of the former governor of Idaho but in Los Angeles in 1912, it was Darrow himself who was on trial, charged with an attempted bribe of a juror. This made-for-television biographical dramatization of Darrow’s life provides an insight into this brilliant, somewhat unorthodox, lawyer who relied upon the power of the spoken word. Starring Kevin Spacey as Clarence Darrow, with Erin Cressida Wilson, Rebecca Jenkins, Chris Cooper, Paul Klementowicz, Calista Flockhart.

results.title: Darling do you love me?
results.creator_credit: BFI, Martin Sharp and Bob Whittaker
results.brief_description: A cynical and comical view of “love” in which a woman drives herself into a frenzy when demanding that her lover declare his affections. Germaine Greer as the large vampire lady, pursues and assaults her lover (Alister Burke) with cries of “Darling, do you love me?”, until he expires under her stranglehold.

results.title: Darling child
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: Kalin’s short video works function both as visual poems and as alternative music videos. With their astute conjunctions of image, music and text, these tapes respond to issues of sexuality and human interaction in the 1990s. In Darling Child, Kalin uses an economy of means spare visuals of an interior space, minimalist music to create an evocative, metaphoric interpretation of a text by Truman Capote. “But we are alone, darling child, terribly, isolated from the other; so fierce is the world’s ridicule we cannot speak or show our tenderness; for us death is stronger than life, it pulls like a wind through the dark, all our cries burlesqued in joyless laughter; and with the garbage of loneliness stuffed down us until our guts burst bleeding green, we go screaming round the world, dying in our rented rooms, nightmare hotels, eternal homes of the transient heart.” — Truman Capote, Other Voices, Other Rooms.

results.title: Darkman [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Robert Tapert and Sam Raimi
results.brief_description: Long before he released “Spider-man”, director Sam Raimi delved into the world of comics when he created the character Darkman, an amalgam of numerous anti-heroes. Liam Neeson stars as Doctor Peyton Westlake, a devoted partner to his soon to be wife (Frances McDormand) and a kindly scientist working on a synthetic skin that will revolutionise the process of skin grafting. There is only one draw back to the procedure; it melts after 99 minutes in the sun. One night there is an attack on Westlake’s laboratory and he is beaten, tortured and placed in a vat of acid. Against all odds Westlake survives, Doctors remove his neurons to alleviate the pain, and Westlake discovers he now has increased strength with a rage to match. Using this newfound energy, he escapes from the hospital to the remains of the lab, makes use of his synthetic skin, calls himself “Darkman” and vows to seek revenge. Making use of the pliability of his new facial structure, Darkman is able to disguise himself to arch nemesis Durant (Larry Drake) as well as reclaiming his fiance from the clutches of another man. Unlike many other superheros, Darkman is not concerned with helping others but focuses on his own cause. Raimi takes great comic delight (if one views “Night of the living dead” as funny) in focusing on the reality and consequence of Westlake/Darkman’s actions, especially as it is wreaked on his two dimensional victims. Music by Danny Elfman. Cameos by John Landis, Jenny Agutter and Bruce Campbell.

results.title: Dark wind
results.creator_credit: Northfork Motion Pictures, Patrick Markey and Errol Morris
results.brief_description: Dark Wind is a tangled web of deceit between two law enforcements. Lou Diamond Phillips plays Jim Chee a young police officer working on a reserve in Arizona belonging to the Navajo’s. He finds himself in constant dispute with the local sheriff of the Hopi clan who want to share the reserve with the Navajo’s. Into the web is a robbery, a plane crash and a decaying body that has been in the desert for some time and the mysterious call in the wind of death. Nothing is as it seems in this electric thriller set amongst ritual and superstition of the people of Arizona. Cast also includes Fred Ward, Gary Farmer, John Karlen.

results.title: Dark rain
results.creator_credit: Kingcroft Productions, John Kingsford-Smith and Jack Gardiner
results.brief_description: The work of the Hunter Valley Research Foundation in investigating causes and the remedies for erosion, floods and drought in the Hunter River Valley, and the silting of Newcastle Harbour. Dams such as the Glenbawn will control the river and provide more water for irrigation. Indicates the effect on primary production.

results.title: Dark eyes
results.creator_credit: Exelsior Film-TV, Rai Uno Radiotelevisione Italiana, Silvia D'Amico Bendico, Carlo Cucchi and Nikita Mikhalkov
results.brief_description: Romano’s marriage leaves him dissatisfied, until a visit to a spa where he falls in love with a mysterious Russian lady. But when he follows her to Russia, the dream dissolves. Based on Chekhov’s classic ‘Lady with a little dog’, leading Soviet director Nikita Mikhalkov’s first film abroad is richly romantic - and ironic. Mastroianni plays the Chekhovian anti-hero to perfection, supported by a magnificent Italian and Russian cast. Mastroianni won the Best Actor award at Cannes in 1987 for his performance. Also stars Silvana Mangano. Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Dark cave
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Dark Cave (previously `That poured its hot breath’) is an evocation of memory and identity that takes the form of a poetic video diary. Kalin endows intimate ‘home movie’ scenes of travel and personal life with mystery and melancholy. A quote from Alfred Chester serves to destabilize the lyrical nostalgia of the rhythmic images.

results.title: Dark cargoes: the Australian slaving system
results.creator_credit: Greenapple Media, Lensie Matthews and Tony Matthews
results.brief_description: Archival material, descendants of Pacific islanders and historian Robert Dansie recall the foundation of misery upon which the Queensland sugar industry was largely built. The institution of indentured labour by Queensland’s Governor Bowen and wealthy Queensland pastoralists resulted in a slave trade reminiscent of the southern United States before the American Civil War.

results.title: Dark angel
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Samuel Goldwyn and Sidney A. Franklin
results.brief_description: Set against the backdrop of a World War I ravaged England, this superbly acted romantic drama is a true classic. Merle Oberon is a revelation as a reformed vamp torn between two men - Herbert Marshall and Frederic March, the latter having returned from the war blinded. The script was adapted by Lillian Hellman from the play by Guy Bolton (a.k.a R. B. Trevelyan).
